div.l: Thus swyved was the carpenters wif
For al his kepyng · and Ialowsie
And Absolon hath kist hir nether eye
And Nicholas is scalded in myddes the toute
This tale is don · and god save al the Route
¶ Here endith the Millers tale
¶ The Prolog of the Reves tale
Than folk had I laughen · at this nyce caas
Of Absolon / and hend Nicholas
Dyủers folk diủersly · they saide
And for the more part · they lough and they pleyde
Ne at this tale · I sye noman hym greve
But it were only · oswold the Reve
Bi cause he was · of carpenters craft
A litel Ire is in his herte I laft
He gan to grucche · and blame it a lite
So thikke quod he · ful wele I cowde the quite
With bleryng of a proude Millers eye
If that me list · to speke of Ribawdye
But ik am old · me list nat pley for age
Gras tyme is don · my foder is now forage
This white toppe · writeth myn old yeeris
Myn herte is also mowled · as is myn heris
But iche fare · as doeth anopyn ers
That ilke fruyte · is eủer lenger the wers
Til it be Roten in hey · or in stree
We old men I Rede · so fare wee
